alert.note: Alert for Fergus County below 4500ft; Snowy and Judith Mountains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 2:47PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Fergus County through 330 PM MDT... At 246 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles west of Grass Range to 12 miles east of Lewistown. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized flooding and gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Giltedge and Forestgrove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
